dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5931 IH: Countering Chinese Threats to U.S. National Security in Africa Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rose introduced the following bill
Referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To require a briefing from a senior official of the Department of Defense on actions by the People’s Republic of China in Africa that pose a threat to United States national security.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Countering Chinese Threats to U.S. National Security in Africa Act.

section.header: Briefing on actions by the People’s Republic of China in Africa that pose a threat to United States national security
section.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense, acting through the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for African Affairs or another appropriate senior official of the Department of Defense, shall brief members of Congress on the actions by the People’s Republic of China in Africa that pose a threat to United States national security and the plan of the Department to counter such threats.
